707150f-a.text:
(1)
Ave. V, south side, at the S.W. corner o0(73rd Street. A view of the Stoothoff hergen House, sections of which are said to have beeu built as early as 1633; hosever the records are not definite or certain. In old history it was on Bergen or Broken Island, completely surrournded by water. On the maps of 1929,the building is not in existence. On the omaps of 1908 it appears as the Kings Hotel, erected in 1652.
1923.
Eugene L: Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, a closer view.
May 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
707150f-a.folder: Ave. V & 73rd St. E., Brooklyn, NY

707151f-a.text:
Ave. V at the S.W. corner of East 73rd Street, showing the Bergen House, Bergen Island. See other views for more data.
1906.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
707151f-a.folder: Ave. V & 73rd St. E., Brooklyn, NY

707152f-b.text:
(1)
Ave. V, at the S,W. corner of East 73rd Street, showing the Stoofhoff-Bergen house. "TPe Bergen house stands on what was Bergen Island, which was granted in 1646 by Governor Kieft to Captain John Underhill, the famous New Englander who was employed by Governor Eieft to fight the Pequot Indians. The island was then called by the Dutch "eller's Island," and by the Indians "Wimbaccoe," and was sold by Underhill to Thomas Spicer, who bought from the Indians what rights they then held. Spicer is said to have built the old house in 1656, soon after the erection of the Schenck-Crooke house. The house was bought of Spicer's heirs in 1665 for 125 guilders in wampum by Elbert Elbertse, who came frog North Brabant and owned six hundred acres in Flatlands. And later, through inheritance and purchase, the house came into the hands of John Bergen, whose heirs finally sold it to the speculators who laid out Bergen Beach.in 1893. Johannes Bergen (1764-1824) added the east wing and in 1819 enlarged the main buildiag: his son, Cornelius (1798-1865)
added the west wing.
-1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, a view of the front with the east wing on the right.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
707152f-b.folder: Ave. V & 73rd St. E., Brooklyn, NY
